H0.text: Solubility is the property, along with shape, by which proteins are categorized, and it correlates with the protein’s shape.

H1.text: Viscosity is the property with which proteins are categorized according to shape and which correlates with it.

H2.text: Size is the property that, together with shape, is used to categorize proteins, and it correlates with the shape of the proteins.

H3.text: Salinity is the property that, together with shape, is used to categorize proteins and that correlates with their shape.

A4.text: By physical size, proteins are classified as nanoparticles, between 1–100 nm.
